title: Inexplicable Input Lag?
body:
In the clip I attached, you can see an example of my problem, toward the end you can see I move my mouse backward and I click, but the game doesn't register the move command. (you don't see the move command)

I tried repairing the client, restoring default settings, disabling full screen optimization, nothing has worked.

recent network log result: https://i.imgur.com/2Y2mxhF.png

I noticed this happening about a couple weeks ago, but I can't figure out why or how to fix it.

replies.body: It looks like a typical packet loss problem in my opinion

> [{quoted}](name=Victorious Nasus,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=osz0oAII,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-11-20T08:43:18.055+0000)
>
> It looks like a typical packet loss problem in my opinion

But I checked my network logs and there aren't any signs of packet loss, I've done extensive virus scans (and I shouldn't have a virus anyway) and my connection is fine in every instance... So I don't really think it's packet loss. I googled input lag and watched examples of it, and this problem looks identical to it. I'm willing to try anything though, so if you have any suggestions please tell me.

Edit: maybe it is packet loss? But I don't understand it... Is it my ISP?

heres a speedtest: https://i.imgur.com/FWCHGuO.png

Like Victorious Nasus mentioned, this is almost definitely packet loss. Essentially that means that your connection is getting corrupted or losing bits of data before it reaches our servers which is why your champion takes a moment to respond sometimes or why it looks like they're moonwalking/teleporting sometimes.

It's easy enough to test for by using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run a traceroute to your server, in your case NA which is 104.160.131.1. Run that trace for me and post the results here so I can take a look and let you know where you should go next.
woke up and tested this morning, issue is still here.

THESE IS RED BOTTOMS THESE IS BLOODY SHOES
sorry {{sticker:sg-lulu}}
I have this same exact problem and tried all the fixes you listed too, so you're not alone. No clue how to fix it.
